alert.note: Alert for Blair (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 6:57PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN BLAIR COUNTY THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 657 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hollidaysburg, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and dime size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Hollidaysburg, Roaring Spring, Martinsburg, Claysburg, Ski Gap, Canoe Creek State Park, Royer, East Freedom, Newry and Blue Knob Ski Resort. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
